intro: Pavetta subcana, commonly known as the smooth pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small white or pale yellow flowers. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. Pavetta subcana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along riverbanks.
